paper_title.en: Fluidity of Aqueous Slurry of Alumina-Coated Calcium Carbonate Powder

description.ja: A CaCO<SUB>3</SUB> powder was coated with a chelate compound of aluminum and heated at 300°Cto prepare the AL<SUB>2</SUB>O<SUB>3</SUB>-coated CaCO<SUB>3</SUB> powder. The apparent viscosity of the aqueous slurry with the AL<SUB>2</SUB>O<SUB>3</SUB>-coated CaCO<SUB>3</SUB> powder was lower than that of the aqueous slurry with the uncoated CaCO<SUB>3</SUB> powder. The hydrophilic property of the CaCO<SUB>3</SUB> powder was improved by means of AL<SUB>2</SUB>O<SUB>3</SUB>-coating. The AL<SUB>2</SUB>O<SUB>3</SUB>-coated CaCO<SUB>3</SUB> powder was homogeneously dispersed in water due to the hydrophilic property. The homogeneous dispersion of the AL<SUB>2</SUB>O<SUB>3</SUB>-coated CaCO<SUB>3</SUB> powder decreased an amount of water restricted on the particle surface and improved the fluidity of the aqueous slurry.
description.en: A CaCO<SUB>3</SUB> powder was coated with a chelate compound of aluminum and heated at 300°Cto prepare the AL<SUB>2</SUB>O<SUB>3</SUB>-coated CaCO<SUB>3</SUB> powder. The apparent viscosity of the aqueous slurry with the AL<SUB>2</SUB>O<SUB>3</SUB>-coated CaCO<SUB>3</SUB> powder was lower than that of the aqueous slurry with the uncoated CaCO<SUB>3</SUB> powder. The hydrophilic property of the CaCO<SUB>3</SUB> powder was improved by means of AL<SUB>2</SUB>O<SUB>3</SUB>-coating. The AL<SUB>2</SUB>O<SUB>3</SUB>-coated CaCO<SUB>3</SUB> powder was homogeneously dispersed in water due to the hydrophilic property. The homogeneous dispersion of the AL<SUB>2</SUB>O<SUB>3</SUB>-coated CaCO<SUB>3</SUB> powder decreased an amount of water restricted on the particle surface and improved the fluidity of the aqueous slurry.

paper_title.ja: X-ray and neutron scattering study of the structure of lithium bismuthate glass

paper_title.en: Structural investigation of SnO-B2O3 glasses by solid-state NMR and X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy
X-ray and neutron scattering study of the structure of lithium bismuth oxide glass

description.en: The structure of (100-x)Bi2O3·xLi2O (25≤x≤35mol%) glasses has been investigated by means of X-ray and neutron scattering methods. Comparing the glasses with several bismuthate crystals in total correlation function T(r), it is concluded that a large amount of edge-sharing BiOn polyhedra are present in the glasses and the network structure is similar to the Bi2O4 crystal. In the crystal, BiO6 octahedra form a layer sharing their four corners mutually, and the BiO4+4 distorted polyhedra are placed between the layers sharing all the edges with the neighboring polyhedra. Assuming two different Li sites in the Bi2O4-based structure, structural models were constructed to compare T(r), from which it was suggested that some Li ions substituted for the octahedral Bi site and some occupied an interstitial vacant site. In addition, the glasses have various defects such as excess O ions, positive-holes on O ions, vacant space to accept atmospheric oxygens, and Bi vacancies. The glass formation is sensitive to the melting conditions, such as temperature and period, suggesting that there exists some optimum quantity in the defect structures. © 2002 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.
